body.p: We are proud to introduce our new Oxygen AI Positron Assistant add-on, which provides support for helping technical documentation writers generate and re-write content by using the Oxygen AI Positron service.
The Oxygen Positron Service uses the OpenAI ChatGPT model GPT-3.5 to provide document generation, change suggestions, and translation capabilities.

section.title: Overview
section.p: Let's simplify and assume that a technical documentation writer's work is done in two stages: analysis and implementation. Usually, in the analysis stage, the technical documentation writer could use resources like web search, ChatGPT, or discussions with colleagues or engineers to further understand the subject they are writing about.

In the second stage, the technical documentation writers use tools like to write the actual content. Our Oxygen AI Positron Assistant add-on explores various ways that we can use ChatGPT to help writers while editing or reviewing the technical documentation, give hints about what to write next, improve readability of content, or re-structure the content in various ways.
Content received from the OpenAI ChatGPT model may be inaccurate or contain misleading information so it needs to be properly revised.
The terms of use for the service can be found here.
As always, we are interested in your feedback and in your improvement suggestions.

section.title: Manual Installation
section.p:
To manually install this add-on, follow this procedure:
Go to Help Install new add-ons to open an add-on selection dialog box. Enter or paste https://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Addons/default/updateSite.xml in the Show add-ons from field or select it from the drop-down menu.
Select the Oxygen AI Positron Assistant add-on and click Next.
Read the end-user license agreement. Then select the I accept all terms of the end-user license agreement option and click Finish.
Restart the application.
Result: The AI Positron Assistant and AI Positron Activity side views are now available.

section.title: Connecting to the Positron Service
section.p: You can use the AI Positron Assistant side view to easily configure login details and connect to the Oxygen Positron Service in the web browser. For now the service is free to use for up to 250 requests per month and a paid subscription may be added as an option in the future.

section.title: Generating Content
section.p:
Once you log in to the server, the following actions for generating content are available in the AI Positron Assistant side view, in the AI Positron Assistant popup menus, and in the AI main menu:
Content Generation
Continue Writing - Continues the idea in the current paragraph by generating extra content.
Follow Instructions - Replaces the selected instructions with content generated based on them.
DITA Topic Tools
Improve Readability - Improves the readability and corrects spell check problems in the selected content, while preserving its original XML markup.
Generate Topic - Generates a DITA XML topic starting from some ideas entered in a configuration dialog box.
Short Description - Generates a short description (shortdesc element) based on a summary of the selected text.
Index Terms - Generates a keywords element that contains index terms obtained from the selected text and inserts it in the prolog.
Itemize - Converts the content of a selected paragraph into a summary and a list of items.
Join Items - Converts a selection that contains a list of items into a single paragraph.
Translation
The actions translate the selected text to the target language (English, German, French, Japanese) preserving the original XML markup.
Overview
Readability - Suggests changes to improve readability of the selected content.
Summarize - Generates a summary of the selected content.
Results for various reports and information about each executed action appear in the AI Positron Activity side view.

section.title: Future Improvement Ideas
section.p:
Here's a list of possible future ideas for using AI to improve the tech docs processes:
Support for converting between various text formats like Markdown or ASCIIDoc to DITA XML.
Support to automatically change the content based on comments left by reviewers.
Support to chat directly with the AI system.
More actions to change tone of voice (active/passive/marketing) for existing content.
